intro: Eriogonum anemophilum var. cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, a feature that reflects its anemophilous nature. This species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
